consistent with regulations under  secs 13291340  reserved article ii  drainage general purpose the drainage fee is hereby established for the purpose of raising funds for the construction enlargement and maintenance of storm water drainage systems to assist in solving drainage problems caused or contributed to by development of property the drainage fees shall be computed on the basis of the area of the property being developed and shall be applied to all newly developed property in the city limits  drainage facilities fee the fee imposed shall be calculated on the gross lot area of the real property being developed as determined by the building inspector there shall be a minimum fee charge as set forth in the fee schedule construction of churches public clinics and hospitals schools and public structures shall be exempt from the drainage facilities fee  payment of drainage fees a the drainage fee or fees shall be paid at the time application is made for a building permit under no circumstances shall the building official issue a certificate of occupancy until the drainage facilities fee is paid in full b if more than one 1 building is to be constructed on the property being developed as for example in the case of a planned unit development or a planned residential unit the total fees shall be allocated among the several buildings in proportion to the square footage of the buildings and a pro rata portion of the drainage fees shall be paid as each application for a building permit is made  drainage fee schedule the fee schedule shall be set by resolution of the city council and may be amended from time to time      storm water drainage fee a there is hereby created a storm water drainage fee to be assessed against residential and nonresidential utility customers in order to provide revenue to improve repair and maintain the citys storm water drainage infrastructure b all nonresidential utility customers will be assessed on the square footage of flat area nongreenbelt of their property and all residential customers will be assessed a flat fee established from the average size of their property using an eru equivalent residential unit c the fee rate shall be set by resolution of the utility enterprise board and may be amended from time to time by resolution the initial fee rate is set by resolution 2007005  secs 13461360  reserved article iii  water system and water treatment facilities creation of water system and water treatment facilities there is hereby created and established a water system and water treatment facilities for the purpose of management maintenance care and operation of the water system and water treatment facilities of the city    powers of operations director  city administrator the operations director shall have the immediate control and management of all things pertaining to the city waterworks system and the operations director shall perform all acts necessary for the prudent efficient and economical management and protection of said waterworks the fort lupton utility enterprise board shall have the power by written resolution to prescribe such other and further rules and rates as it may deem necessary technical services of a qualified engineer may be used in all cases wherein the operations director does not have the requisite engineering knowledge and experience to make decisions requiring such technical services the city administrator is authorized to promulgate regulations guidelines and procedures consistent with this by the fort lupton utility enterprise board as are members of the fire department for fire suppression purposes and which is accessible to any public highway alley or private way open to or generally used by the public unless such person first secures a permit for use from the public works director and the city administrator c only wrenches specifically designed for operation of fire hydrants shall be used in said operation and all other tools are strictly forbidden      use of water  operations director to manage users of water from a designated city fire hydrant shall be assessed a permit fee which shall be valid for a period of one 1 year the user shall also be required to pay for water at the thencurrent rate there shall be no charge for unmetered standby fire protection service the fort lupton fire protection district the fort lupton utility enterprise board reserves the right to cause the water to be shut off in the water mains when the operation director deems the shut off to be necessary the operations director for the purpose of repairing or making connections for extensions to the water system or water treatment facilities or for the purpose of cleaning the same may shut off the water at any time  provided that before the water shall be turned off from any school or public building the operations director shall notify the occupant or person in charge of such building  and in all cases of turn off for such repairs or connections not determined to be an emergency by the operations director affecting industrial commercial or residential buildings the operations director shall notify the occupant or person in charge of such buildings      secs 13681380  reserved article iv  water policies damage to water system and water treatment facilities property prohibited it shall be unlawful for any person to in any way material into the water system which will in any manner injure or obstruct the water or water treatment facilities system or pollute or contaminate the city water    interference with water facilities prohibited a it shall be unlawful for any person to trespass upon the property of the city to tap any water mains or to make any connections therewith without first having obtained a permit to do so b it shall be unlawful to in any manner interfere with the city or the property equipment pipes valves or any other appliances of the city or to change or alter the position of any valve or appliance regarding the flow of water in any pipeline  change of water use it shall be unlawful for any person to alter change enlarge or extend in any manner whatsoever the type of use for which water was taken and used from the water system and water treatment facilities except as approved by the operations director    connections to water lines and mains it shall be unlawful for any person to make any connections with any water pipeline main which forms a part of the water system and water treatment facilities except pursuant to and in accordance with the permit required by this shall be unlawful to make any connections to any privately owned water mains or pipelines which are connected with the water utility or to change alter or renew any presently existing private main or pipeline connected with the water utility with any pipe larger than that in use unless approved by the operations director    backflow prevention and cross connection control program a purpose 1 the purpose of the the program adopted herein is to provide for the preservation and promotion of the public health welfare and safety of the inhabitants of the city and of the public and for the preservation and promotion of the convenience good order tranquility prosperity happiness morals best interest and general welfare of said people the intent is to protect the public water system from contaminants or pollutants that could enter the distribution system by backflow from a customers water supply system service connection 2 the fort lupton backflow prevention and cross connection control program is designed to provide the city procedures for the implementation maintenance and enforcement of backflow prevention practices pursuant to federal and state regulations pertaining to crossconnection control b pursuant to title 31 parts 1 and 2 crs there is hereby adopted by reference the fort lupton backflow prevention and cross connection control program prepared and maintained by the city public works the city clerk shall certify to the passage of this make one 1 copy of the adopted plan available to the public during regular business hours c authority the authority to implement this program is contained in the following statute legislation and regulations and acts 1 of title 25 of the colorado revised statutes crs 2 of 5 ccr 100211 colorado primary drinking water regulations 3 colorado plumbing public works director shall have the authority to survey all service connections within the distribution system to determine if the connection is a crossconnection the public works director shall have the authority to control all service connections within the distribution system if the connection is a crossconnection the public works director shall maintain records of crossconnection surveys and the installation testing and repair of all backflow prevention assemblies installed for containment and containment by isolation purposes except as otherwise provided herein the public works director shall administer implement and enforce the provisions of this d applicability this to all commercial industrial and multifamily residential service connections within the public water system and to any persons outside the city who are by contract or agreement with the public water system users of the public water system this not apply to singlefamilyresidential service connections unless the public works director becomes aware of a cross connection at the single family connection e requirements 1 commercial industrial and multifamily service connections shall be subject to a survey for cross connections if a cross connection has been identified an appropriate backflow prevention assembly and or method shall be installed at the customers water service connection within one hundred twenty 120 days of its discovery the assembly shall be installed downstream of the water meter or as close to that location as deemed practical by the public works director if the assembly or method cannot be installed within one hundred twenty 120 days the public works director must take action to control or remove the cross connection suspended service to the cross connection or receive an alternative compliance schedule from the colorado department of public health and environment 2 backflow prevention assemblies and methods shall be installed in accordance with of the citys standards the citys construction specifications and colorado plumbing 3 the public works director shall require inspection testing maintenance and as needed repairs and replacement of all backflow prevention assemblies and methods and of all required installations within the owners plumbing system in the cases where containment assemblies and or methods cannot be installed 4 all costs for design installation maintenance testing and as needed repair and replacement are to be borne by the customer 5 no grandfather clauses exist except for fire sprinkler systems where the installation of a backflow prevention assembly or method will compromise the integrity of the fire sprinkler system 6 for new buildings all building plans must be submitted to the public works director and approved prior to the issuance of water service f inspection testing and repair 1 backflow prevention assemblies or methods shall be tested by a certified crossconnection control technician upon installation and tested at least annually thereafter the tests shall be made at the expense of the customer 2 any backflow prevention assemblies or methods that are nontestable shall be inspected at least once annually by a certified crossconnection control technician the inspections shall be made at the expense of the customer g reporting and recordkeeping 1 copies of records of test reports repairs and retests or replacements shall be kept by the customer for a minimum of three 3 years 2 copies of records of test reports repairs and retests shall be submitted to the public works director by mail facsimile or email by the testing company or testing technician h right of entry a properly credentialed representative of the public works director shall have the right of entry to survey any and all buildings and premises for the presence of crossconnections for possible contamination risk to and for determining compliance with this section this right of entry shall be a condition of water service in order to protect the health safety and welfare of customers throughout the public water systems distribution system i compliance 1 customers shall cooperate with the installation inspection testing maintenance and as needed repair and replacement of backflow prevention assemblies and with the survey process for any identified uncontrolled crossconnections the public works director shall complete one 1 of the following actions within one hundred twenty 120 days of its discovery a control the cross connection b remove the cross connection c suspend service to the cross connection 2 the public works director shall give notice in writing to any owner whose plumbing system has been found to present a risk to the public waters systems distribution system uncontrolled cross connection the notice and order shall state that the owner must install a backflow prevention assembly or method at each service connection to the owners premises to contain the water service the notice and order will give a date by which the owner must comply a in instances where a backflow prevention assembly or method cannot be installed the owner must install approved backflow prevention assemblies or methods at all crossconnections within the owners water supply system the notice and order will give a date by which the owner must comply j violations and penalties any violation of the provisions of this ordinance shall upon conviction be punishable as provided in all applicable statutes laws and regulations k conflict with other codes if a dispute or conflict arises between the colorado plumbing adopted herein and any plumbing mechanical building electrical fire or other code adopted by the state then the most stringent provisions of each respective code shall prevail  editors note adopted  repealed the former 1385 and enacted a new 1385 as set out herein the former 1385 pertained to similar subject matter and derived from the prior code 125441 125442 repaired by the water user at his or her expense no claim shall be made against the city on account of breaking of service pipes or apparatus or for failure in the supply of water and no reduction in the rates will be made for any time that service pipes or fixtures are frozen or are not in proper working order all connections taps and lines that are or will become the responsibility of the city for maintenance shall be inspected by the citys authorized representative prior to being backfilled and used c the city shall be responsible for all maintenance and repairs to service pipes and fixtures installed between the city main and meter pit or curb box whichever is closer to the city main d crossconnections with any other water supply is strictly prohibited e the water service line from the street main to the water distribution system of the building to be served with water shall be of sufficient size to furnish an adequate flow of water to meet the requirements of the building and premises at peak demand and in no case shall be less than threefourths 34 of an inch in diameter f new services to replace existing services shall not be approved by the city until the old service lines are completely disconnected from the curb stop or meter pit and the water is turned off at the corporation cock shutoff at the main and inspected by city staff        installation of lines all shall cause to be installed all service lines with meter pits or curb stops and meter risers as the city determines necessary to serve said property when fully developed  shutoff for repairs and extensions and mains the city reserves the right to shut off the water from any street main when necessary to make repairs or extensions of the water mains or to perform any other work necessary to maintain the water utility unless it is an emergency situation the city will attempt to give reasonable notice to the water users no claim shall be made against the city by reason of any breakage or service pipe or service cock or for any other damage that may result from shutting off water for repairing or replacing mains hydrants or other connections  waste of water prohibited consumers shall any person now using or who shall hereafter use any private well for domestic or household use within the city shall within ten 10 days from the effective date of the ordinance codified in this or within ten 10 days from the commencement of use of such well report such use to the city b it shall be the duty of the owner of such well to have said well and the water therefrom examined by the county department of health within thirty 30 days from the effective date of the ordinance codified herein or if such well is hereafter put in use before using such well for household or domestic use and to have said well so examined per county health regulations and forward a copy of all reports to the city within fifteen 15 days c it shall be the duty of the owner of such well to file with the city clerk a written report from the county department of health of each examination required by this d the provisions of subsections a b and c above shall not be applicable to wells used exclusively for irrigation e it shall be unlawful for the owner of any private well to connect such well in such manner as to permit the water therefrom to enter any pipe connected with the public water mains of the city f it shall be unlawful for any person to use any private well for domestic or household purposes after the waters from said well are found by the county department of health to be unsafe or development water requirements a any person annexing land to or developing within the city or adding any new water taps within the city limits connecting to the citys water system who has not size of water meters raw water requirements per meter will be based on the schedule referenced in d below 2 in the event that the land to be annexed has no water rights or shares or has an amount of water rights or shares that is not sufficient to meet the requirement an additional water dedication shall be made to the city to satisfy the requirements of this 3 the city administrator shall determine a cashinlieuofwater fee on a quarterly basis or as needed based upon the thencurrent market price for coloradobig thompson cbt water shares this will be done by contacting water brokers water consultants and those with knowledge of current water prices this cashinlieuofwater fee will be used as the basis for assessing water dedications required for new water taps 4 the utility committee and the planning commission shall make recommendations to the city council in all annexation proceedings on matters appropriate to their jurisdictions specifically in the matters of the pay the entire cost of extending the city water service to his or her subdivision and shall deed to the city all mains and service connections required to serve his or her subdivision the city shall pay the difference pursuant to for any oversize pipe which is required as a result of any master plan adopted by the city for service of water to any area either within or outside of the existing city limits all extensions shall conform to city specifications b for subdivisions inside or outside the city limits the citys main extension policy shall be as follows 1 the city will extend or require the subdivider to extend the required water main to the subdivision to be served if the subdivider is required to extend the main then the city will negotiate a repayment agreement with the subdivider which will allow said subdivider to recoup as much of the cost of the extension between the boundary of his or her subdivision and the nearest properly sized city water main as can be agreed upon it shall be the citys policy that the subdivider shall pay for the extensions of any water line for his or her subdivision 2 in the event no agreement can be made between the city and the subdivider then the city shall not be responsible to extend the main    water and sewer billing and collection a statements for the charges of water services will be dated and mailed out to the water users monthly no later than fourteen 14 days after the water meter read date in the event a water bill is not paid by the end of the following month in which it was sent the finance director or citys agents shall serve upon or mail the water user a delinquent notice in writing giving a minimum of ten 10 days from the date of the notice for payment to be made or the water will be turned off on the premises served in the event such bill is not paid by the due date given on this notice the finance department or citys agents shall be authorized to cause the turnoff of the water service forthwith on the premises served until the delinquent bill has been paid together with any service charges plus any exceptional costs b the city shall have as security for the collection of such water utility charges service charges and fees a lien upon the real property served which lien shall become effective immediately upon the supplying of such water and shall not be discharged until all charges for water service service charges and fees as provided herein have been paid c in the event the lien provided in b above is not discharged by payment the finance director is authorized by city council and the fort lupton utility enterprise board to collect such delinquent charges for water service service charges and fees and charge such collected amounts in the same manner as taxes pursuant to crs d may be tested or inspected as deemed necessary if any meter is repaired or replaced because of a defect in the meter such repair or replacement due to obsolescence shall be performed at the expense of the city if a meter is repaired or replaced due to damage other than damage caused by the city personnel the cost of repair or replacement including materials and labor shall be charged to the users account if a meter is replaced due to a change by the user to a larger size meter such replacement shall be performed at the expense of the user b all meters readouts pits and other materials shall be of a size type design and quality approved by the city and shall be installed in a readily accessible location for the meter reader each meter shall be inspected and found to be correct and properly adjusted before installation c water meters shall be installed in an outside meter pit with a remote reading device at a location specified by the city the city shall have the right to specify the location for the placement of the meter and readout d a record shall be made and preserved of each meter installed giving the location serial number and size of the meter    connection and inspection premises address differs from the address to which billings are sent said notice shall include the following 1 notification that water andor sewer service will be suspended on the date specified in the date specified in the notice water or sewer service as the case may be shall be suspended and shall not be reinstated until the cause for suspension has been cured prior to reinstatement of service to the premises all charges due including disconnection and reinstatement charges referred to in this shall be paid d appeals any appeal from the decision of the city administrator with respect to suspension of service shall be submitted in writing to the fort lupton utility enterprise board within twenty 20 working days from the date of the city administrators decision such an appeal shall set forth with particularity the grounds therefor notwithstanding such appeal service shall be or remain suspended unless the appeal is accompanied by 1 a payment of the amount in dispute  or 2 an amount determined as being sufficient to insure continued compliance with all applicable ordinances rules and regulations which amount shall be specified in the city administrators decision e the fort lupton utility enterprise board shall review the proceedings before the city administrator and within twenty 20 working days after receipt of the appeal shall enter the boards written ruling based thereon a copy of which ruling shall be sent by certified mail to the owner or occupant in the event the decision is adverse to the owner or occupant all administrative recourse in connection with the suspension of service shall be deemed to have been exhausted and the owner or occupant may thereupon pursue such further remedy as the owner or occupant may choose        customer complaint procedures any owner or occupant having any complaint with respect to conduct or action of any employee of the city in connection with operation of the municipal water and sewer systems or in connection with administration or implementation of any ordinance rule regulation or policy related to the operation of said system with the exception of termination of service for any of the reasons specified in above may submit a written complaint to the city administrator outlining in detail the basis of said complaint the city administrator shall make such investigation as may appear necessary and shall enter a written ruling with respect to the complaint a copy of such ruling shall be mailed to the complaining owner or occupant by certified mail within twenty 20 working days from the date of receipt of the complaint in the event the ruling of the city administrator is adverse to the owners or occupants contentions the owners or occupants administrative remedy shall be deemed to have been exhausted and the customer may thereupon pursue such other remedy as he or she may choose        water leaks inasmuch as it is to the benefit of the entire community to conserve water a property owner who provides proof that they fixed a water leak on their property in a prompt and timely manner may receive a credit adjustment on their next utility bill consistent with regulations under it is the intent of this policy that the city will share in the cost of the excess water in order to encourage the property owner to fix any water leaks in a timely fashion  inactivation and termination of water and sewer services a an account will be considered active if the water curb stop is turned on by the city an account will be considered inactive if the curb stop is turned off by the city for any reason b upon request by the customer the city will temporarily disconnect the premises from water service a fifteendollar reconnect fee will be charged upon reconnection the monthly base service charge for both water and sewer shall continue to accrue during the period of temporary disconnection c water and sewer services may be inactivated for a period not exceeding five 5 consecutive years by the city upon written request of the owner provided that the property is not occupied and all outstanding water and sewer fees have been paid at the time the tap is requested to be inactivated during inactivation there will be no water flow to the property for any purpose nor any discharge to the sewer if the property owner at any time during the fiveyear inactive period desires to reactivate the water and sewer tap he or she must pay any base fees that accrued during said period before the city will allow the account to be reactivated property owners with active water and sewer services who abandon their property without properly requesting to inactivate their account will continue to accrue base fees until the city suspends water and sewer service pursuant to d the city may terminate water and sewer services and disconnect the water and sewer tap connections to any structure where the owner evidences in writing an intent to abandon the service connection selling the property to another is not sufficient intent for abandonment prior to a determination by the city that a water or sewer service connection is abandoned by the owner the owner shall be provided a hearing with the city administrator at the owners request the city administrator may determine based upon the evidence present at such hearing that a water or sewer tap should not be terminated upon payment by the property owner of any fee charge or cost identified below e unless there is a separate prior written agreement any application for an enlargement change in use classification or reactivation of an inactive connection pursuant to d above shall constitute a new connection and all applicable water rights and requirements fees water or sewer tap fees and charges associated with additional charges a there shall be charged and added to the water and sewer utility bill a fee of fifteen dollars $1500 each time a municipal water user or his or her agent requests that the city turn on and restore municipal water service that has been turned off at the request of or by the water user or his or her agent said fee shall be charged at the time the water service is turned on and shall be added to the users water bill during the period that a municipal water users service is turned off said municipal water user shall be responsible for the payment of the monthly base service charge for water and sewer service including irrigation meters b water service may be discontinued upon request by the owner lessee or user of water the city may require an affidavit signed by the owner lessee or user prior to shutoff the affidavit shall include the service address reason for the shutoff request and whether the property is owner occupied tenant occupied or vacant water shall not be discontinued if the reason for the requested shutoff is related to a landlordtenant dispute if the shutoff is granted there shall be a fee of fifteen dollars $1500 to restore the water service c every time a water service employee takes a reading of the meter other than the normal monthly reading there shall be a charge of fifteen dollars $1500 d if a customer requests a meter check high water bill each time thereafter e an emergency turnoff due to a water leak in the service line will not be charged a turnoff fee but the customer will be charged a fifteendollar turnon fee on the utility bill if the city turns on the water f users of water from a designated city fire hydrant shall be assessed a twentyfive dollar $2500 permit fee which shall be valid for a period of one 1 year for water taken at the current water rate in the event any quantity charges remain unpaid sixty 60 days after the completion of the project the user shall not be permitted to use fort lupton municipal water again until all outstanding amounts have been paid and all remedies available at law shall be pursued to collect the unpaid water taken all users of water from fire hydrants shall apply for a hydrant meter from the city and supply their own backflow prevention equipment or may use a water meter provided by the city after payment of a one thousand five hundred dollar $150000 deposit any costs for damage to the water meter will be deducted from the deposit g there shall be no charge for unmetered standby fire protection service to the fort lupton fire protection district but the fire department shall report the quantity used to the finance department on a monthly basis h users of water for new construction shall be assessed a twentyfivedollar fee per month to cover costs of water used during the time of construction excluding the use of water for seeding or sodding a lawn this policy authorizes use of water only for the building for which the permit is issued twentyfive dollars $2500 shall be charged and collected at the time a building permit is issued the charge shall be twentyfive dollars $2500 per month thereafter with no proration of days until the water meter is installed and turned on the remaining amounts due shall be paid prior to the issuance of the certificate of occupancy a water meter shall be installed prior to outside seeding or sodding to measure under the jurisdiction of the city in compliance with the colorado municipal annexation act of 196 as amended this provides standards for annexation and for compliance with other provisions of this   pt 1 responsibilities of applicant a in addition to other duties imposed upon all applicants by this the colorado municipal annexation act of 196 as amended the act all applicants shall have the following responsibilities 1 the applicant is responsible for having a representative at all meetings of the planning commission and of the city council where the request is reviewed failure to have a representative present will be cause to have the item withdrawn from the agenda of that meeting 2 the applicant shall consult with the planning department to discuss any special conditions pertaining to the annexation and to obtain an annexation petition and application materials b all fees for all annexation applications shall be as shown in the city of fort lupton general fee schedule as adopted and revised by resolution by the city council     pt 1 annexation policy a the city council shall have the sole discretion in the annexation of territory proposed for annexation to the city and the city is under no obligation to approve any annexation petition b land to be annexed shall conform to the goals policies and strategies of the city c the petitioner for annexation of land to the city shall be responsible for paying all required fees and for all related costs and overhead incurred by the city in reviewing and processing the annexation petition d annexation shall not divide tracts of land in such a way as to prevent annexation of adjoining land e all annexations shall be accompanied by an agreement between the petitioner and the city stating conditions related to municipal services or other terms of annexation that are not specifically provided for in the f unless specifically deferred by the city council zoning of the property shall occur concurrently with the annexation proposed zoning shall conform to a concept land use plan submitted with the annexation petition in the event that sufficient planning has not been done to define zoning boundaries at the time of annexation the city may zone the property a agricultural as an interim zoning classification g in accordance with this sufficient water rights shall be deeded to the city at the time of annexation unless alternate provisions are approved in the annexation agreement h required contiguity of noncontiguous parcels proposed for annexation may be achieved by annexation of one 1 or more general provisions title this be known as the zoning the city of fort lupton and may be cited and pleaded as such pt 1   zoning fees a all zoningrelated fees shall be as provided for in this as shown in the city of fort lupton general fee schedule as adopted and updated by resolution by the city council b review fees the applicant shall be responsible for payment of application fees as adopted by the city council and for payment of reasonable fees to cover the actual costs of administration overhead professional and consulting services inspection publication of notice and other activities of the city and its agents incurred in processing a zoningrelated application payment of the fees shall be as follows 1 application fee applicants shall pay to the city an application fee in an amount set by resolution of the city council 2 fee deposit in addition to the application fee the applicant shall pay to the city the actual cost of staff time and professional or consulting services rendered in connection with the review of the proposed zoningrelated application plus fifteen percent 15% to cover administrative overhead professional or consulting services include but are not limited to legal planning and engineering services the city may require a deposit from applicants to offset the citys costs for review prior to consideration of any application submittal pursuant to this city may also require deposit of additional fees during the consideration of a zoningrelated application in the event that actual costs plus overhead exceed the original deposited amount the city may not process or continue to process a zoningrelated application and may not approve an application unless sufficient fees have been deposited to cover such costs any fees paid that are remaining on deposit with the city after paying the citys actual costs plus overhead shall be refunded to the applicant upon completion or termination of the application process 3 application fees and fee deposits shall be paid upon submittal of a completed land use application or notice of appeal applications which are not accompanied by the appropriate fee shall be considered incomplete and shall not be processed nor shall any permit be issued until the appropriate fee is received by the city 4 the city will send statements to the applicant as necessary including an accounting of the actual costs and overhead incurred to date in processing the application such statements may also include a requirement that additional funds be deposited with the city in the event that earlier deposits were insufficient the applicant shall pay the amount due on the statement within fifteen 15 days of the date of issuance of such statement 5 if the statement is not paid in full within thirty 30 days after issuance of the statement the city shall impose interest on the amount due and outstanding for actual costs and overhead to date at the rate of one and onehalf percent 15% per month from the date when due 6 the city may certify to the county treasurer any amount due pursuant to this a lien on the property for which the application is submitted to be due and payable with the real estate taxes for the city if the applicant or the property owner does not pay such amount within thirty 30 days of written request by the city 7 fees as set forth within this shall be due and payable regardless of whether the proposed application is completed or approved andor regardless of whether the owner or applicant chooses to complete the citys review process pt 1 purpose this designed to encourage the most appropriate use of land throughout the city and to ensure a logical growth of the various physical elements of the city  to lessen congestion in the streets  to secure safety from fire panic and other dangers  to provide adequate light and air  to improve housing standards  to conserve property values  to prevent the overcrowding of land to avoid undue concentration of population  to facilitate the adequate provisions of transportation water sewerage schools parks and other public requirements  and in general to promote health safety and the general welfare pt 1 interpretation  conflict with other laws in their interpretation and application the provisions of this be held to be minimum requirements for the promotion of the public health safety and welfare whenever the requirements of this at a variance with the requirements of any other lawfully adopted rules regulations or ordinances the more restrictive or those imposing the higher standards shall govern pt 1 territorial limits of regulations the regulations prescribed in this apply within the corporate limits of the city pt 1 zoning of annexed areas any territory hereafter annexed to the city may be zoned simultaneously with the annexation proceedings as provided by statute pt 1 definitions for purposes of this the following words shall have the meanings ascribed hereafter abandoned sign means a sign which advertises or identifies an outofbusiness moved or nonexisting business or service accessory building structure or use means a building structure or use located or conducted upon the same lot or on a contiguous lot under one  deed in the same ownership as the principal building structure or use to which it is related and which is clearly incidental to and customarily found in connection with such principal building or use accessory dwelling means an apartment integrated within a singlefamily dwelling or located in a detached accessory building such as carriage houses or agriculturaltype outbuildings located on the same lot as singlefamily dwellings and complying with the standards in this identification sign means a sign which is incidental to the primary use and is on the same property as the building or use being identified or advertised ie home occupation for rent family name alley means a public or private way at the rear or side of the property permanently dedicated as a means of secondary vehicular access to the abutting property and generally having less width than a street appeal means a request by an applicant to the board of adjustment for a review of any administrative interpretation of any provision of this wrecking means the dismantling or wrecking of used motor vehicles or trailers or the storage sale or dumping of dismantled obsolete or wrecked vehicles or their parts but not including the incidental storage of damaged vehicles in connection with the operation of a repair garage also see junk yard awning means a framed structure supported from the exterior wall of a building which can be retracted folded or collapsed or remain stationary as a part of the building awning sign means a sign attached to or integrated into an awning banner means a strip of fabric which is used as a sign stretched across two 2 points and is temporary in nature basement means the portion of a building between floor and ceiling which is entirely below grade or partly below and partly above grade but so located that the vertical distance from grade to the floor below is more than the vertical distance from grade to ceiling billboard means a sign which directs attention to a business commodity service or entertainment conducted sold or offered at a location other than the premises on which the sign is located boarding house or rooming house means a building other than a hotel cafe or restaurant where for compensation directly or indirectly lodging andor meals are provided for three 3 or more boarders andor roomers exclusive of the occupants family building means any structure built for the shelter or enclosure of persons animals chattels property or substance of any kind excluding fences the word building includes the word structure building area means the maximum horizontal area within the outer perimeter of the building walls building coverage means that area or portion of a lot which is occupied or covered by all buildings on that lot area included as coverage shall be that area defined herein as building area building detached means any building separated from another building on the same lot building enclosed means a building separated on all sides from adjacent open space or other buildings by fixed exterior walls or party walls with opening only for windows and doors and covered by a permanent roof building frontage means the side of the building which contains a primary entrance building height means the vertical distance measured from the average of finished grade at the center of all walls of a building to the uppermost point of the roof a the following shall be included in determining the building height penthouses ventilators enclosures for mechanical equipment skylights parapet walls and other appurtenances b the following shall be excluded in determining building height church spires chimneys and private television antennas building principal means one 1 building housing the principal primary or most important uses permitted for the lot upon which it is located building setback means the minimum distance between the building or structure and each of the property lines the setbacks will be determined by the building envelope ie measuring in from the front back and side lot lines by the number of allowed setback distances to create the maximum allowed size of the building footprint and based on the descriptions of the front rear and side yards contained in this site means a footprint of a principal building child care center means a facility by whatever name known that is maintained for the whole or part of a day for the care of five 5 or more children who are eighteen 18 years of age or younger and who are not related to the owner operator or manager thereof whether such facility is operated with or without compensation for such care and with or without stated educational purposes the term includes but is not limited to facilities commonly known as day care centers schoolage child care centers before and afterschool programs nursery schools kindergartens preschools day camps summer camps and centers for developmentally disabled children and principal permitted use or within a planned unit development a group of permitted uses pt 1 special uses a intent in order to provide flexibility to provide a means for setting performance standards for individual land uses and to help diversify uses within a zoning district specified uses are permitted in certain districts subject to the granting of a special use permit the list of permitted uses in each zone district is exclusive meaning that uses not specifically described are not permitted but similar uses and compatible uses may be permitted as special uses as set forth in this of their unusual or special characteristics special uses require review and evaluation so that they may be located properly with respect to their effects on surrounding properties the review process prescribed in this intended to assure compatibility and harmonious development between special uses surrounding properties and the city at large special uses may be permitted subject to such conditions and limitations as the city may prescribe to ensure that the location and operation of the special uses will comply with special use criteria special uses are granted to individuals or entities and not to the property itself special uses lapse as a matter of law without hearing or notice upon cessation of the specific granted use for a period exceeding one hundred eighty 180 days the scope and elements of any special use may be limited or qualified by the conditions applicable to the specific property where conditions cannot be devised to achieve these objectives applications for special use permits shall be denied b special use permit process 1 preapplication conference and site visit before submitting an application for a special use permit the applicant shall meet with representatives from the planning department to discuss the applicants intended submittal the citys application requirements and processes and other information relevant to the proposed application the meeting might also include a visit to the site 2 application the applicant shall submit an original and a sufficient number of copies of application materials as determined by the planning department for distribution and review by the city all copies of maps and large sheets shall unless otherwise requested by the city be properly folded prior to submittal 3 neighbor meetings the applicant is encouraged to meet with adjacent landowners and homeowners associations concerning the application 4 public hearing date the city shall set a date for consideration of the application by the planning commission at a public hearing and shall notify the applicant of the hearing date 5 design review team the planning department may present the application to the drt for review and comment 6 publication the city will publish notice of the planning commission hearing date time and location at least fifteen 15 days prior to the hearing in the event that the date of the subsequent city council hearing can be anticipated at that time notice of the city council hearing may be combined with this notice 7 posting at least fifteen 15 days prior to the planning commission public a special use permit is revoked by the city council or if it lapses the owner may apply for another special use permit pursuant to the provisions of this pt 1     boundaries and districts interpretation where uncertainty exists as to the boundaries of districts as shown on the official zoning district map the following rules shall apply 1 boundaries indicated as approximately following the centerlines of streets or highways shall be construed as following such centerlines 2 boundaries indicated as approximately following platted lot lines shall be construed as following such lot lines boundaries indicated as approximately following city limits shall be construed as following city limits 3 boundaries indicated as following railroad lines shall be construed to be midway between the main tracks 4 boundaries indicated as following shorelines shall be construed to follow such shorelines and in the event of change in the shoreline shall be construed as moving with the actual shoreline 5 boundaries indicated as approximately following the centerline of streams rivers or canals shall be construed to follow such centerline 6 boundaries indicated as parallel to or extensions of features indicated in paragraphs 1 5 above shall be so construed distances not specifically indicated on the official zoning district map shall be determined by the scale of the map pt 1 changes and amendments a cityinitiated amendments the planning commission may from time to time on its own motion or the motion of the city council or recommendation from city staff recommend amendments supplements or changes in boundaries or regulations herein or subsequently established b general rezoning of the city whenever the city initiates largescale amendments of the official zoning map or when the official zoning map is in any way to be changed or amended incidental to or as part of a general revision of the zoning whether such revision is made by repeal of the existing zoning enactment of a new zoning otherwise the requirement of an accurate survey map or other sufficient legal description of the posting of property and the notice to and listing of names and addresses of owners of real property in the area of the proposed change shall be waived however the proposed amendments shall be available for public inspection in the city hall during regular business hours for fifteen 15 days prior to the public hearings on such amendments c privately initiated amendments any person may apply for an amendment to the official zoning map d process for amending the official criteria 1 the city shall use the following criteria to evaluate the applicants request and shall not approve an amendment except a to correct a manifest error in an ordinance establishing the zoning for a specific property b to rezone an area or extend the boundary of an existing district because of changed or changing conditions in a particular area or in the city generally c if the current zoning is inconsistent with the policies and goals of the comprehensive plan d if the proposed rezoning is necessary to provide land for a communityrelated use that was not anticipated at the time of the adoption of the comprehensive plan and the rezoning will be consistent with the policies and goals of the comprehensive plan e if the area requested for rezoning has changed or is changing to such a degree that it is in the public interest to encourage development or redevelopment of the area 2 the zoning map amendment shall not substantially alter the character of the district or the neighborhood 3 spot zoning the zoning map amendment will not create a spot zone 4 adequate conditions of approval shall address traffic  activity levels  light  noise  odor  building type style and scale  hours of operation  dust  erosion and other performance issues identified public hearing process 5 this declaration of criteria for zoning map amendments shall not control an amendment that occurs incidentally to a general revision of the zoning map    enforcement the planning department shall have authority to enforce this from the decision of the planning department may be made to the board of adjustment  board of adjustment composition duties the word board  when used in this shall be construed to mean the board of adjustment the board shall consist of five 5 members and shall be appointed by the mayor with the approval of the city council each to be appointed for a term of three 3 years except appointments in 2006 will be one 1 member appointed for a oneyear term  two 2 members appointed for a twoyear term  and the remaining two 2 members for a threeyear term if a member resigns during his or her term and creates a vacancy the new member shall only serve the remainder of the vacancy the terms of each member shall be staggered so that no more than two 2 persons terms will expire at the same time one 1 alternate member may be appointed who shall act as a regular member of the board when any other member is absent from a meeting persons elected or appointed to the city council or persons who are officers executives or employees of the city shall not be eligible for appointment to the board the board shall hear and decide appeals from any order requirement decision or determination hereinafter referred to as a city action made by an administrative member of the staff relating to building or zoning codes it shall also hear and decide all matters referred to it by the city council or the planning department or upon which it is required to pass under this concurring vote of four 4 members of the board shall be necessary to reverse any order requirement decision or determination or to decide in favor of the applicant any matter upon which it is required to pass the board shall be subject to review by certiorari by the district court of weld county such appeal may be taken by any person aggrieved or by an officer department board or bureau of the city meetings of the board shall be held as required the board shall elect its own chairperson during the month of february each year for a term of one 1 year the board shall adopt the roberts rules of order and shall keep minutes of its proceedings showing the action taken regarding each question considered the board shall present to the planning department its decisions in writing    appeals a intent the appeal process is intended to provide relief to persons who wish to challenge an interpretation or decision regarding this city staff b appeal process 1 the board of adjustment board shall hear and decide appeals from any interpretation order requirement decision or determination hereinafter called the action made by any administrative official charged with the enforcement of this 2 any applicant deciding to appeal any city action must file with the planning department a written notice of appeal on forms provided by the city and the required application fees within ten 10 days following the action appealed from specifying a the action taken by the city and the date taken  b the grounds for appeal  and c the relief requested the scope of the appeal shall be limited to those specifications 3 following receipt of a notice of appeal the planning department shall then notify the chairperson of the board of adjustment the city attorney and the staff person involved and provide each with a copy of the notice of appeal the city attorney may reject the appeal as to form if it does not contain the three 3 required categories of information set forth in paragraph 2 above the applicant shall have an additional five 5 days to file an amended notice of appeal the application fee is not refundable for rejection as to form 4 hearing and jurisdiction the board shall fix a reasonable time for the hearing of the appeal give due notice thereof to the parties and decide the same within a reasonable time the board shall not consider matters beyond its jurisdiction or not within its authority and the city attorney may render a legal determination on such matters before or during the hearing hearings shall be open to the public upon any hearing any party may appear in person or by agent or attorney the applicant shall be provided the opportunity to present any evidence documentation or argument in support of his or her position raised in the notice of appeal and may be questioned by the applicant members of the board the city attorney or administrative staff the city may present any evidence documentation or argument in support of the citys position and may be questioned by the applicant members of the board or the city attorney testimonial evidence need not be under oath but may be if the board so requires the board shall make its findings and conclusions on the record the board may reverse or affirm wholly or partly or may modify the order requirement decision or determination appealed from within the scope of the notice of appeal and to that end has all the power of the administrative staff member from whom the appeal is taken the board may consider an applicants unique hardship as long as the applicant did not create his or her own hardship buying property without knowledge of facts that are available about the property does not create a hardship failing to verify or misinterpretation by the applicant of any city code does not create a hardship convenience or profit alone shall not constitute undue hardship 5 the board has no authority to create a use that does not exist under the zoning allow what is specifically prohibited in this those codes adopted by reference 6 no single decision of the board sets a precedent the decision of the board shall be made on the particular facts of each case 7 appeal criteria for administrative interpretation the board of adjustment in hearing an appeal from an interpretation of this shall consider a the technical meaning of the provision being appealed  b evidence of the manner in which the provision has been interpreted in the past  c the positive or negative impact of the requested appeal on the achievement of stated city development goals and objectives  and d the intent of the provision in implementing the comprehensive plan 8 in approving a requested interpretation the board of adjustment shall provide a written record of its findings and the staff shall use it to propose amendments that address future interpretation problems 9 refund if the board of adjustment reverses the administrative decision appealed from in whole or in part the city shall refund the appeal application fees to the applicant pt 1 variances a intent the variance process is intended to provide relief to persons who are unable to conform to the provisions of this to unusual requirements of this variance shall not be granted if it would be detrimental to the public good create a conflict with the comprehensive plan or impair the intent and purpose of this c variance process 1 preapplication conference and site visit before submitting an application for a variance the applicant may meet with representatives from the planning department to discuss the applicants the property is located  b is in the public rightofway or on public property  c alters any definition of the   d is other than the minimum variance that will afford relief with the least modification possible to the requirements of the   e is based on physical conditions or circumstances of the property so general or recurring in nature as to reasonably make practicable the formulation of a general regulation to be adopted as an amendment to the   f is based exclusively on findings of personal or financial hardship the board may consider the hardship the applicant may suffer as long as the applicant did not create his or her own hardship buying property without being aware of available facts about the property does not create a hardship failing to verify or misinterpretation by the applicant of any city code does not create a hardship convenience profit or caprice shall not constitute undue hardship  or g will result in the extension of a nonconforming situation use building or lot  authorize the initiation of a nonconforming use of land or conflict with the goals and policies of the comprehensive plan 2 in order to grant a variance to the the board of adjustment shall find that all the following have been satisfied a that there are unique physical circumstances or conditions of the land such as irregularity narrowness or shallowness of the lot or exceptional topographical or other physical condition of the land particular to the affected property  b that because of these unique physical circumstances or conditions the property cannot be reasonably developed or used in compliance with the provisions of the   c that such unique physical circumstances or conditions are unique and unusual or nearly so rather than shared by many surrounding properties  d that due to such unique physical circumstances or conditions of the land the strict application of the create a demonstrated hardship  e that the demonstrable hardship is not selfimposed  f that the hardship or poor land use of which the applicant complains is one suffered by the applicant alone and not by neighbors or the general public  g that the variance if granted will not adversely affect the proposed development or use of adjacent property or the neighborhood  h that the variance if granted will not change the character of the zoning district in which the property is located  i that the variance if granted is in keeping with the intent of the   j that the variance if granted in a floodplain or floodway meets the requirements of floodplains and floodways of this any other applicable law  k that the variance if granted will not adversely affect the health safety or welfare of the citizens of the city  and l that the variance requested is the minimum necessary to provide relief f operation and monitoring the city may establish and carry out procedures as are reasonably necessary to ensure compliance with the conditions of approval of the variance failure of a landowner to comply with the conditions of a variance shall constitute a violation pt 1   minor administrative variations the planning director after consulting with the chairperson of the board of provided by this more than one 1 such variation may be granted to the same standard on any property written notice of any administrative variation shall be provided to the owner of the property and a copy kept on file with the city pt 1   vested property rights a for all developments the sitespecific development plan for purposes of of title 24 crs shall be as defined in this b in the event an applicant for a sitespecific development plan approval wishes said approval to have the effect of creating vested property rights pursuant to of title 24 crs the applicant must so request in writing at least thirty 30 days prior to the date said application is to be considered by the city council c in the event amendments to a sitespecific development plan are proposed and approved the effective date of such amendments for purposes of duration of a vested property right shall be the date of the approval of the original sitespecific development plan unless the body granting final approval of such amendments specifically finds to the contrary and incorporates such finding in its approval of the amendment d the city council may revoke a vested property right for failure to abide by the terms and conditions of such vested property right prior to taking action to revoke a vested property right the city council shall provide a public hearing to the affected landowner and shall provide at least fourteen 14 days prior written notice mailed to the property address of record in the county assessors office as well as provide notice in the same manner as the posting or publishing of ordinances and resolutions the mailed notice to the landowner shall specifically identify the terms and conditions which are not in compliance with the sitespecific development plan approval during the period of determining compliance with the terms and conditions of a sitespecific development plan approval the city may administratively withhold any building utility excavation road cut or other city permit and may withhold acceptance of additional development applications or processing of existing development applications for the property subject to the sitespecific development plan e a pending sitespecific development plan application will be governed by the duly adopted laws and regulations in effect at the time the application is submitted with the exception that the city reserves the right pursuant to 2 crs to enforce new or amended laws or regulations to pending applications when such law or regulation is necessary for the immediate preservation of public health and safety including temporary development restrictions duly adopted by ordinance for the purposes of preparing planning studies and considering land use regulations related to public health and safety or for the purpose of promoting concurrency of essential public infrastructure equipment or services with increased demand f nothing in this intended to create any vested property right but only to implement the provisions of of title 24 crs in the event of the repeal of said a judicial determination that said invalid or unconstitutional this be deemed to be repealed and the provisions hereof no longer plan must be at least ten 10 acres in size 6 approval approval of a final pud plan by the city council shall be by ordinance d intent pud provisions are intended to further the following objectives 1 to permit and encourage innovative design and high quality masterplanned urban developments on large parcels of land 2 to permit greater flexibility in the application of zoning and development standards and greater freedom in providing a mix of land uses in the development of a balanced community 3 to preserve critical environmental resources provide aboveaverage open space and recreational amenities include exceptional design and provide greater efficiency in the layout and provision of roads utilities and other infrastructure 4 to provide flexibility in land planning and development resulting in amenable relationships between buildings and ancillary uses and permitting more intensive use of land where wellrelated open space and recreational facilities are integrated into overall design 5 to encourage unity and diversity in land development resulting in convenient and harmonious groupings of uses structures and common facilities varied type design and layout of housing and other buildings and appropriate relationships of open spaces to intended uses and structures 6 to encourage unified and planned development of a site with or without customary subdivision into single lots and without specific application of the district regulations as provided for individual lots subject to the regulations set forth herein 7 to provide for and encourage the preservation and enhancement of desirable natural landscape and other features unique to a development site 8 to provide reasonable standards and criteria by which the specific proposals for a pud can be evaluated 9 to provide a procedure which can relate the design and layout of unified residential commercial or industrial developments to the particular site and demand for such development in a manner consistent with the preservation of property values within established residential areas e general location and planning requirements 1 relation to major transportation system pud districts shall be located with respect to major streets and highways or other transportation facilities to be directly accessible without creating traffic on minor streets in residential areas outside such district 2 relation to public utilities and community facilities pud districts shall be located in relation to public utilities and community facilities and services either existing or to be available by the time development reaches the stage where they will be required so that such facilities can be provided at reasonable cost and with reasonable efficiency 3 relation to general pattern of urban development pud districts shall be planned and located in general compliance with the comprehensive plan and shall relate to the major elements of the urban pattern including housing commercial facilities and principal places of employment by physical proximity of major streets so as to provide for the convenience and amenity of residents of the community and to reduce general traffic congestion by a close relationship between origins and destinations f physical character of the site the site shall be suitable for the development proposed without hazards to structures occupants or any property from probability of flooding on the site or on adjacent lands from erosion or deposition of eroded material on adjacent lands from subsidence of the soils or from other dangerous conditions soil groundwater level drainage and topography shall be appropriate to both the kind and pattern of use intended g site planning  external relationships 1 vehicular access entrances and exits for vehicles and the provision for the granting of special uses for similar but unlisted uses from time to time new novel or nontraditional uses may be proposed or put into use in a given zone district even though principal building or use b utility sheds are not accessory buildings c only a use which is incidental to the permitted use and which complies with all of the following conditions may be operated as an accessory use 1 the use is clearly incidental and customary to and commonly associated with the permitted use 2 it is operated and maintained under the same ownership and on the same building site as the permitted use 3 it does not include structures or structural features inconsistent with the permitted use 4 it does not include residential occupancy except by domestic employees employed on the premises d the term accessory use does not include home occupations no use which is prohibited as a home occupation is permitted as an accessory use in a residential district no accessory use is designed and constructed to be compatible with the principal building pt 1 nonconforming use regulations a the lawful use of land existing at the time of the passage of this although such use does not conform to the provisions hereof may be continued  but if such nonconforming use is discontinued for a period greater than one 1 year any future use of land shall be in conformity with the provisions of this building whose structure or use is nonconforming such as a commercial building in a residential zone district is an unlawful nonconforming building if such nonconforming use is or has been discontinued for a period greater than one 1 year b the lawful use of a building or part thereof existing at the time of the passage of this be continued although such use does not conform to the provisions hereof and such use may be extended throughout the building provided that no structural alterations except those required by law or ordinance are made therein c whenever a nonconforming building or use of a building has been changed to a more restrictive use or to a conforming use such use shall not thereafter be changed to a less restricted use when a nonconforming building is damaged by fire explosion flood act of god or a public enemy to the extent of more than fifty percent 50% of its fair value it shall not be restored except in conformity with the regulations of the district in which it is situated any addition to a structure that has nonconforming uses or new structure built adjacent to a structure that has nonconforming uses shall be required to meet current setbacks for that zone district no building permit shall be issued for a structure or use that would violate this pt 1 nonconforming lots where an individual lot was held in separate ownership from adjoining properties or was platted prior to the effective date of this a recorded subdivision approved by the city council and has less area or width than required in other sections of this such a lot may be occupied according to the permitted uses and subject to the standards provided for the district in which such lot is located in cases where reasonable use of such lots is impractical due to shape or size owners may apply for variances and be subject to the applicable provisions of this pt 1 home occupations a intent it is the intent of the city to permit commercial activities to be conducted within dwellings in specified zoning districts and on a limited basis when the nature of the activities does not attract large numbers of customers or clients and is not evident or detrimental to the peace enjoyment and quality of life in the surrounding neighborhood b standards for home occupations home occupations must meet the following standards 1 other than residents of the dwelling containing the home occupation there shall be no more than one 1 additional full or parttime employee working at the site of the home occupation 2 the employee and clients may park in offstreet parking spaces on the site of the home occupation or in onstreet spaces adjoining the site of the home occupation 3 space used by the home occupation shall not exceed five hundred 500 square feet or thirty percent 30% of the total floor area of the dwelling whichever is less the home occupation shall be conducted entirely within the dwelling or designated accessory buildings 4 the home occupation shall be clearly incidental and secondary to the use of the dwelling for dwelling purposes and must not change the residential character thereof 5 there shall be no change in the outside appearance of the dwelling or of the premises or other visible evidence of the conduct of such home occupation except for a limited amount of signage as specified in this 6 there shall be no exterior storage on the premises of material merchandise or equipment used as a part of the home occupation 7 no equipment or process shall be used in such home occupation which creates any glare fumes odors noise or other objectionable conditions detectable to the normal senses at the property line if conducted in a singlefamily dwelling or outside of the dwelling unit if conducted in a multifamily dwelling 8 home occupations may not generate more than ten 10 businessrelated vehicle trips per day 9 the following uses shall not be permitted as home occupations motor vehicle boat or trailer repair or service  machine or welding shops  sexually oriented businesses  or any other businesses that attract more than two 2 clients or customers at any one 1 time pt 1 secs 16661680  reserved article iv parking and access except rear yards unless such parking and access approaches a paved surface b in all commercial zone districts it shall be unlawful to create new parking areas or storage areas for any vehicle outside of an enclosed structure on an offstreet unimproved surface or create access to and from public rightsofway without asphalt or concrete paving of such areas according to existing city standards except for rear yards that abut unimproved public rightsofway c integrate parking lots with surroundings parking lots shall not dominate the frontage of pedestrianoriented streets
